item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Based on what I've researched, insei training is very geared towards playing lots of games and game reviews by stronger players. Of course, this is a proven method that has produced many professionals; however, the flaw I find in this program is the fact that amateurs cannot engage in this type of study the way insei do. So my goal is to hopefully build a program that is catered to the non-professional go community. =)
item.content:encoded: Based on what I’ve researched, insei training is very geared towards playing lots of games and game reviews by stronger players. Of course, this is a proven method that has produced many professionals; however, the flaw I find in this program is the fact that amateurs cannot engage in this type of study the way insei do. So my goal is to hopefully build a program that is catered to the non-professional go community. =)

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: If you mean training program like an insei program online, they have those available, but no real independent training programs.
item.content:encoded: If you mean training program like an insei program online, they have those available, but no real independent training programs.

item.title: By: Devin Flake
item.dc:creator: Devin Flake
item.description: Sounds like a cool idea - keep us posted on your progress. I wouldn't mind trying a go training program :)
item.content:encoded: Sounds like a cool idea – keep us posted on your progress. I wouldn’t mind trying a go training program ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Ah I see! I will be sure to consider your blueprint as I'm formulating one myself. I'm hoping to design guidelines for players who need a more detailed training menu: Example: - 50 Easy Life and Death Problems - 10 Intermediate Life and Death Problems - 1 Full Game Review where you must determine the purpose of every move. - And so on and so on... =D
item.content:encoded:
Ah I see! I will be sure to consider your blueprint as I’m formulating one myself. I’m hoping to design guidelines for players who need a more detailed training menu:
Example:
– 50 Easy Life and Death Problems
– 10 Intermediate Life and Death Problems
– 1 Full Game Review where you must determine the purpose of every move.
– And so on and so on…
=D

item.title: By: Paul
item.dc:creator: Paul
item.description: That was my suggestion for a training menu. Do any combination of tsumego/joseki/games/reviews. Ask "why?" and "how?" the whole time. ;)
item.content:encoded: That was my suggestion for a training menu. Do any combination of tsumego/joseki/games/reviews. Ask “why?” and “how?” the whole time. ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: You make an excellent point. I think part of my search is also determining the actual training menu that allows a person to make consistent progress. Similar to the boxing training menu, I'm hoping to design a go training menu as well to make consistent progress. =)
item.content:encoded: You make an excellent point. I think part of my search is also determining the actual training menu that allows a person to make consistent progress. Similar to the boxing training menu, I’m hoping to design a go training menu as well to make consistent progress. =)
